action.action-desc: Mr. Jeffries (for himself and Mr. Collins of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prevent certain monitoring and interception by Federal authorities of Federal prisoner communications that are subject to attorney-client privilege.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Effective Assistance of Counsel in the Digital Era Act .

section.header: Prisoner communications that are subject to attorney-client privilege

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b) it shall be unlawful for any person acting under the authority of the United States to monitor any electronic communication (as defined in section 2510 of title 18, United States Code) to which a prisoner in a Bureau of Prisons correctional facility is a party, if that communication is subject to attorney-client privilege.
Subsection (a) does not apply to a communication the Attorney General has reason to believe poses a threat to national security.
The Attorney General shall prescribe rules to carry out this section.
